claim: AI-driven change will be uneven across industries but will dramatically accelerate science; as intelligence and energy get cheaper, many goods’ prices will fall sharply while luxury goods and scarce resources (e.g., land) may rise, affecting global price structures.
explanation: Partly accurate. Evidence shows AI’s impact is uneven across sectors and countries, and AI is already accelerating parts of science (e.g., AlphaFold’s protein-structure breakthroughs and AI‑assisted materials discovery), while clean‑energy costs have generally trended down, improving the competitiveness of new renewables. ([imf.org](https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WP/Issues/2025/04/11/The-Global-Impact-of-AI-Mind-the-Gap-566129?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [oecd.org](https://www.oecd.org/en/publications/oecd-employment-outlook-2023_08785bba-en.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [mckinsey.com](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/mckinsey-digital/our-insights/The-economic-potential-of-generative-AI-The-next-productivity-frontier?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [science.org](https://www.science.org/content/article/breakthrough-2021?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [deepmind.google](https://deepmind.google/discover/blog/millions-of-new-materials-discovered-with-deep-learning/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [prod.iea.org](https://prod.iea.org/reports/world-energy-outlook-2024/executive-summary?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [iea.org](https://www.iea.org/reports/renewable-energy-market-update-june-2023/executive-summary/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [lazardltd.gcs-web.com](https://lazardltd.gcs-web.com/news-releases/news-release-details/lazard-releases-2025-levelized-cost-energy-report?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Economic research also finds that when productivity rises in tradable/automatable domains, relative prices of those goods tend to fall while prices of scarce or hard‑to‑automate items (e.g., services and land) rise; recent data show persistent services‑led inflation and that rising land values explain most of the long‑run house‑price boom. ([bis.org](https://www.bis.org/publ/qtrpdf/r_qt2403d.htm?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [ifw-kiel.de](https://www.ifw-kiel.de/publications/no-price-like-home-global-house-prices-1870-2012-20483/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) However, the assertions that “many goods’ prices will fall sharply” and that luxury goods will broadly rise are forecasts with mixed current evidence: frontier AI compute remains expensive even as efficiency improves, and luxury prices/demand have recently softened in places. ([epoch.ai](https://epoch.ai/blog/training-compute-of-frontier-ai-models-grows-by-4-5x-per-year?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [bain.com](https://www.bain.com/about/media-center/press-releases/2024/global-luxury-spending-to-land-near-1.5-trillion-in-2024-remaining-relatively-flat-as-consumers-prioritize-experiences-over-products-amid-uncertainty?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Overall, the claim is plausible and directionally supported by current trends, but the magnitude and breadth of the price effects remain uncertain.
